subQuestion.ans: Tic-Tac-Toe:How to play:Draw a 3x3 grid.Two players take turns marking the squares—Player 1 uses 'X' and Player 2 uses 'O'.The goal is to place three of your symbols in a row (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally) before your opponent does.If all squares are filled and no player has three in a row, it's a tie.

subQuestion.ans: The Magic Number 9 TrickSteps:Ask someone to pick any number.Multiply the number by 9.Add all the digits of the result.Repeat until you get a single-digit number.Result:The final number will always be 9.Example:Chosen number: 88 × 9 = 72Sum of digits: 7 + 2 = 9

questions.questionsTitle: Write a short book review of any one of your favourite books. Your review should include the following things.

subQuestion.question: Title of the book
subQuestion.ans: Title of the book -'George's Secret Key to the Universe'

subQuestion.question: Name of the author/authors
subQuestion.ans: Name of the author/authors -Lucy Hawking and Stephen Hawking

subQuestion.question: Name of the illustrator (artist)
subQuestion.ans: Name of the illustrator (artist) -Garry Parsons

subQuestion.question: The central idea of the book (what the book is about)
subQuestion.ans:
The central idea of the book (what the book is about) -George's Secret Key to the Universe" is about a boy named George who goes on a big adventure to learn about space and the stars.
With his friends and a super smart computer called Cosmos, George gets to see all sorts of cool things in the universe, like planets and black holes, without ever leaving his backyard.
The book teaches us how amazing the universe is and shows us why it's important to be curious and to learn new things.
It also tells us that science can be really fun and exciting, and it helps us understand the world around us better.

subQuestion.question: The important characters in the book and what they do
subQuestion.ans:
The important characters in the book and what they do -George: He's the main character who goes on big adventures to learn about the universe.
He's really brave and super curious.George's Dad: He loves the Earth a lot and wants to keep it safe.
He's not a big fan of using too much science and tech because he thinks it can hurt our planet.Annie: She's George's friend who loves adventures too.
Her dad helps them learn about space and the stars.Eric (Annie's Dad): He's really smart and knows a lot about the universe.
He made Cosmos, a super cool computer that can show them the universe.Cosmos: This isn't a person but a very smart computer that can take George and Annie to see space up close without leaving their backyard.The Odd, Angry Scientist: He's the villain who wants to use science for bad things, not to help people or the Earth.

subQuestion.question: What you like about the book
subQuestion.ans:
George: He's the main character who goes on big adventures to learn about the universe.
He's really brave and super curious.

subQuestion.question: Why you want others to read the book/what you learn from the book
subQuestion.ans:
George's Dad: He loves the Earth a lot and wants to keep it safe.
He's not a big fan of using too much science and tech because he thinks it can hurt our planet.

subQuestion.ans: (Ahmad and Kasim are standing near Ahmad's well).Ahmad:Why do you come begging for water time and again?

subAns.Column 2: (thinks to himself) Ahmad would ask for a lot of money but the channel of water which will come running from the field will indeed change my fortune. (Next day)
I bring to you all my savings. I have decided to buy the whole well from you.(Next day Kasim is at the well digging out a channel)
What are you doing Kasim? How dare you touch the water in my presence?
What do you mean? Haven't you sold this well to me?

Ah, I sold the well all right, but not the water in the well. The water still belongs to me, you can't use it. If you needed the water along with the well, you should have said so. I have a suggestion for you, pay for the water separately and use it. You can buy freshwater every day. I don't mind.(Kasim rushes to the Qazi and tells him the whole story. Ahmad is summoned to the court and the Qazi hears his argument patiently and then.....)
Hmm, I see that you are right. What you have sold is the well, the water is all yours. Isn't that so?
My Lord, I am so grateful you understand the fine points of this case. The water does indeed belong to me.

In that case Ahmad, why are you keeping it in Kasim's well? You have no right to keep your belongings in his property. You must remove the water immediately or else, you can pay a daily rent to Kasim. Then he will allow you to use his well.(Ahmad is dumbfounded, people present in the court laugh)
(thinks to himself) I will never trouble Ahmad for the 'rent'. After all I got justice.(Curtain falls)

subQuestion.question: Find out the difference between the fingerspelling method, sign language and Braille.
subQuestion.ans: A sign language is a language that uses body language to convey meaning through movements of the hand, arms, or body, and facial expressions to express the speaker's thoughts.Finger spelling is the process of spelling out words by using signs using fingers that correspond to the letter of the word.Braille is a form of written language for the blind, in which characters are represented by patterns of raised dots that are felt with the fingertips.

questions.questionsTitle: Write a short book review of any one of your favourite books. Your review should include the following things.

subQuestion.question: Title of the book
subQuestion.ans: Title of the book -'George's Secret Key to the Universe'

subQuestion.question: Name of the author/authors
subQuestion.ans: Name of the author/authors -Lucy Hawking and Stephen Hawking

subQuestion.question: Name of the illustrator (artist)
subQuestion.ans: Name of the illustrator (artist) -Garry Parsons

subQuestion.question: The central idea of the book (what the book is about)
subQuestion.ans:
The central idea of the book (what the book is about) -George's Secret Key to the Universe" is about a boy named George who goes on a big adventure to learn about space and the stars.
With his friends and a super smart computer called Cosmos, George gets to see all sorts of cool things in the universe, like planets and black holes, without ever leaving his backyard.
The book teaches us how amazing the universe is and shows us why it's important to be curious and to learn new things.
It also tells us that science can be really fun and exciting, and it helps us understand the world around us better.

subQuestion.question: The important characters in the book and what they do
subQuestion.ans:
The important characters in the book and what they do -George: He's the main character who goes on big adventures to learn about the universe.
He's really brave and super curious.George's Dad: He loves the Earth a lot and wants to keep it safe.
He's not a big fan of using too much science and tech because he thinks it can hurt our planet.Annie: She's George's friend who loves adventures too.
Her dad helps them learn about space and the stars.Eric (Annie's Dad): He's really smart and knows a lot about the universe.
He made Cosmos, a super cool computer that can show them the universe.Cosmos: This isn't a person but a very smart computer that can take George and Annie to see space up close without leaving their backyard.The Odd, Angry Scientist: He's the villain who wants to use science for bad things, not to help people or the Earth.

subQuestion.question: What you like about the book
subQuestion.ans:
George: He's the main character who goes on big adventures to learn about the universe.
He's really brave and super curious.

subQuestion.question: Why you want others to read the book/what you learn from the book
subQuestion.ans:
George's Dad: He loves the Earth a lot and wants to keep it safe.
He's not a big fan of using too much science and tech because he thinks it can hurt our planet.

questions.questionsTitle: Form groups of 5-8. In each group, rewrite the story in the form of a play. Present scenes from your play in the classroom.

subQuestion.question: Form groups of 5-8. In each group, rewrite the story in the form of a play. Present scenes from your play in the classroom.
subQuestion.ans: (Ahmad and Kasim are standing near Ahmad's well).Ahmad:Why do you come begging for water time and again?

subAns.Column 2: (thinks to himself) Ahmad would ask for a lot of money but the channel of water which will come running from the field will indeed change my fortune. (Next day)
I bring to you all my savings. I have decided to buy the whole well from you.(Next day Kasim is at the well digging out a channel)
What are you doing Kasim? How dare you touch the water in my presence?
What do you mean? Haven't you sold this well to me?

Ah, I sold the well all right, but not the water in the well. The water still belongs to me, you can't use it. If you needed the water along with the well, you should have said so. I have a suggestion for you, pay for the water separately and use it. You can buy freshwater every day. I don't mind.(Kasim rushes to the Qazi and tells him the whole story. Ahmad is summoned to the court and the Qazi hears his argument patiently and then.....)
Hmm, I see that you are right. What you have sold is the well, the water is all yours. Isn't that so?
My Lord, I am so grateful you understand the fine points of this case. The water does indeed belong to me.

In that case Ahmad, why are you keeping it in Kasim's well? You have no right to keep your belongings in his property. You must remove the water immediately or else, you can pay a daily rent to Kasim. Then he will allow you to use his well.(Ahmad is dumbfounded, people present in the court laugh)
(thinks to himself) I will never trouble Ahmad for the 'rent'. After all I got justice.(Curtain falls)

subQuestion.question: How did Helen overcome her handicaps?
subQuestion.ans: Helen overcame her handicaps because of her own courage and also that of her wonderful teachers from whom she learned to read, write and talk.

subQuestion.question: What is meant by 'Honour the white cane'?
subQuestion.ans: The people who are blind or have a partial loss of vision carry a long white cane which signifies that they are self-reliant and independent.

questions.questionsTitle: Find out what 'Braille' is.

subQuestion.question: Find out what 'Braille' is.
subQuestion.ans: Braille is a system of raised dots that can be read with the fingers by people who are blind or who have very low vision.

questions.questionsTitle: Find out the difference between the fingerspelling method, sign language and Braille.

subQuestion.question: Find out the difference between the fingerspelling method, sign language and Braille.
subQuestion.ans: A sign language is a language that uses body language to convey meaning through movements of the hand, arms, or body, and facial expressions to express the speaker's thoughts.Finger spelling is the process of spelling out words by using signs using fingers that correspond to the letter of the word.Braille is a form of written language for the blind, in which characters are represented by patterns of raised dots that are felt with the fingertips.
